message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.NT, cs.CR, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the construction of covering sets, which are important in coding theory for correcting limited-magnitude errors. This falls under the category of information theory (cs.IT). The paper also uses techniques from number theory, such as character sums, which suggests a possible categorization under number theory (cs.NT). The construction of covering sets involves the use of sets and their properties, which could be classified under data structures (cs.DS). The paper also mentions the optimality of the constructed covering sets, which could be classified under computational complexity (cs.CR) or computational complexity theory (cs.CC).
